title: Afternoon Session
commentary: Selling pressure mounts into the final hours: S&P extends losses to -1.2% at 48,970, Nasdaq -1.5% as growth stocks crack—tech breadth deteriorating. Crypto accelerates lower—Bitcoin breaks through support to $65,300 (-3.0%), Ethereum slides to $1,918 (-4.3%) with leveraged positions unwinding. Gold slips to $5,245 (+0.1%) as dollar surges on hawkish rate repricing; oil drops to $65.10 (-2.3%). VIX climbs to 21.2—month-end selloff gaining momentum as funds lock in losses.

title: Early Afternoon
commentary: Markets churn sideways as traders digest hot PCE: S&P holds at -0.9% near 49,120, Nasdaq -1.2% with tech finding tentative support. Fed rate cut expectations for May now down to 15% from 40% pre-data—higher for longer narrative regains traction. Crypto treads water—Bitcoin steady at $65,543 (-1.9%), Ethereum consolidates at $1,925 (-3.2%). Gold eases to $5,260 (+0.3%) as dollar catches a bid on yield differentials; oil flat at $65.50 (-1.7%). Month-end rebalancing flows could add volatility into the close.

title: Midday
commentary: Relief rally fades as sellers regain control: S&P slips back to -1.0% at 49,090, Nasdaq -1.3% with semis leading the decline. PCE came in hot at 2.8% core vs 2.6% expected—stagflation whispers growing louder. Crypto gives back morning gains—Bitcoin retreats to $65,513 (-1.7%), Ethereum falls to $1,928 (-2.8%) as risk appetite evaporates. Gold pulls back slightly to $5,275 (+0.6%) on profit-taking; oil stabilizes at $65.40 (-1.9%). Two-sided tape into the afternoon—conviction lacking on both sides.

title: Late Morning
commentary: Dip buyers emerge as indices find support: S&P pares losses to -0.8% at 49,180, Nasdaq claws back to -1.1% as megacap tech stabilizes. Crypto bounces off session lows—Bitcoin recovers to $66,116 (-1.8%), reclaiming $66K handle; Ethereum lifts to $1,948 (-4.2%) though still below $2K. Gold holds gains at $5,295 (+0.9%) as real yields compress. Oil finds a floor at $65.50 (-1.8%). PCE inflation data due at 10:30—traders watching for confirmation of disinflation trend.

title: Mid-Morning
commentary: Selling intensifies as GDP shock reverberates: S&P plunges to -1.1% at 49,040, Nasdaq -1.5% with growth stocks hit hardest—NVDA and TSLA both down 3%+. Crypto carnage deepens—Bitcoin slides to $65,846 (-2.7%), testing February lows; Ethereum craters to $1,943 (-5.3%) as DeFi tokens bleed out. Gold extends safe-haven rally to $5,310 (+1.2%), best day in three weeks. Oil collapses to $65.20 (-2.3%) as recession fears creep back into the narrative. Bond yields tumbling—10Y down 8bps to 3.97%.

title: Market Open
commentary: Futures tumble as GDP revision disappoints: S&P opens -0.7% at 49,240, Nasdaq -1.1% with tech under pressure after Q4 GDP revised down to 2.8% vs 3.2% expected. Crypto extends losses overnight—Bitcoin breaks $67K support to $66,238 (-2.5%), Ethereum slumps below $2K at $1,963 (-5.0%) in broad risk-off move. Gold surges to $5,285 (+0.8%) as haven flows accelerate; silver follows at $90.10 (+0.9%). Oil slides to $65.80 (-1.4%) on growth concerns. VIX spikes to 19.5—fear returning to the tape.

title: Market Close
commentary: Wall Street ends mixed ahead of GDP: S&P closes flat at 49,585, Dow slips 0.2% as industrials lag, Nasdaq edges +0.1% with tech finding late bids. Crypto closes the session on the back foot—Bitcoin at $67,372 (-2.6%) unable to reclaim $68K, Ethereum settles at $2,026 (-2.4%). Gold holds gains at $5,245 (+0.4%), maintaining its safe-haven premium. Oil closes at $66.75 (-0.4%) with traders awaiting inventory data. All eyes on Q4 GDP revision tomorrow—consensus at 3.2% but whisper numbers suggest upside risk.

title: Into the Close
commentary: Equities drift into the bell as rate concerns simmer: S&P hovers at 49,590 (-0.1%), Nasdaq flat with FAANG stuck in consolidation mode. Crypto steadies after midday volatility—Bitcoin at $67,603 (-2.1% 24h), paring earlier losses as dip buyers step in. Ethereum recovers to $2,030 (-2.0%), holding the $2K psychological level. Gold firm at $5,242 (+0.3%) with haven bid intact; oil edges to $66.85 (-0.3%). GDP revision tomorrow keeps traders cautious—positioning light ahead of the print.

title: Afternoon Session
commentary: Afternoon rally attempt gains traction: S&P grinds higher to -0.2% at 49,580, Nasdaq flat as FAANG names stabilize. Bitcoin reclaims $67K, now $67,327 (-2.9%)—short covering provides lift but conviction lacking. Ethereum retakes $2,005 (-3.2%), ETH/BTC ratio showing relative weakness. Gold holds $5,238 (+0.3%), silver $89.30 (+0.2%) with precious metals bid intact. Oil edges up to $66.70 (-0.5%). VIX retreats to 16.8 from morning highs—fear fading into the close.

title: Early Afternoon
commentary: Markets find tentative footing after morning selloff: S&P claws back to -0.4% at 49,480, Nasdaq -0.6% as dip buyers emerge in mega-cap tech. Bitcoin bounces off session lows to $66,830 (-2.7%)—bears still in control but selling pressure easing. Ethereum holds $1,989 (-4.0%), underperforming BTC ratio. Gold pulls back slightly to $5,240 (+0.4%) on profit-taking; oil flat at $66.50 (-0.8%). Bond market calm with 10Y steady at 4.05%. All eyes on GDP revision tomorrow.
